postverbal; unclear whether this is allomorph of /-ie/, /-rie/, /-sie/, /-ni/; only found on /him/ 'kill' ~ /hibi/ 'kill him/her/it'
emphatic marker; as in: /ʝoni/ 'I myself' (cf. Tok Pisin: mi yet); is this a demonstrative marker?
perhaps only a plural imperative marker: information on dual imperatives is lacking

Comment: used with all possessors except 1sg, 2sg, 3sg, and 3du?

English_Gloss: that (complementizer); that, those (distal adnominal demonstrative); there; because

Comment: cf. Kuanua prefix: Meyer 1961: 27: <băr-> ~ <băra-> 'bedeutet Verwandtschaft' ['means kinship']

English_Gloss: class term prefix for fruits, round things, bunches
Comment: class term prefix for fruits, round things, bunches

English_Gloss: from (ablative preposition); with, along with (comitative preposition)

Comment: same as 'grass'?; related to /de-/ 'one'?; prenominal element
status as preposition is not entirely clear; also /lo/, /lol/, /ŋa/, /ta/, /to/, /o/ (?)
preverbal; possibly occurs in slot otherwise held by real/irr subject marker; exact function is unknown; often pronounced as [ɣa]
occurs with /βua/ 'to look for'; object is that which is sought
verbal meaning?; verbal suffix /-rie/?; genitive preposition /-e/?; cf. /gi/ 'treetop'; used as 'elder/older (sibling)' in Grace (1955a)
literally 'to be where?'; also /au ua/, /ne ua/, /ua/
allomorph of /e=/? (possibly reanalyzed root-initial /h/ of some nouns, e.g., /hobeŋ/ 'lime', /hodie/ 'spear', /holo/ 'woman', /her/ 'rain'; cf. /herek/ 'children', /horek/ 'men')
fossilized plural?; it is not clear whether this is or ever was a prefix; but it seems to alternate with /no-/ (possibly reanalysis involved)

English_Gloss: class term prefix for trees, long things, plants
Comment: class term prefix for trees, long things, plants

English_Gloss: whole, entire; bunch (e.g., of coconuts, areca nuts, bananas)
bottom; base of a coconut shell; stump of a tree
class term prefix for baskets, open things
Comment: class term prefix for baskets, open things, pieces
also /kariŋ/; can be adjectivized with prefix /te-/: /teledel/ 'of the forest, wild'
literally 'at the day the where?'?; also /mla nua/, /tem la nua/
allomorph of /ne=/, generally before labial consonants
postverbal; enclitic?/proclitic? (when an object follows it, it seems to cliticize to the object); perfective marker?; is this related to the [mo] found in luŋmo 'to catch, to hold'?
preverbal; seems to occupy slot otherwise held by real/irr subject marker; function is uncertain; possibly the same morpheme as the adjective marker /me-/; cf. also /me/ 'again'
preverbal (pre-adjectival); occurs with adjectives; function uncertain (from POc *ma- 'stative'?); possibly the same morpheme as the habitual marker /me=/; also /te-/
abbreviated form of /tem la nua/?; also /lo ŋha nua/
used in purpose constructions; can precede either object or clause?; same as /mo/ 'and'?
allomorph of /ne=/, generally before alveolar or palatal consonants
meaning uncertain; occurs with 1sg in irrealis subject marker /sa=na=/ (?)
generally pronounced [ne ~ nɛ], as opposed to the singular marker /ne/ which is generally pronounced [nɛ ~ nə]
meaning uncertain; sometimes occurs with non-1sg irrealis subjects, as /sa=ni=/ or /so=ni=/ (?)
fossilized singular?; it is not clear whether this is or ever was a prefix; but it seems to alternate with /ho-/ (possibly reanalysis involved)
allomorph of /ne=/, generally before velar or glottal consonants
preverbal; irrealis marker used for all subjects except 2sg and 3sg; 1sg perhaps always occurs with /na-/ as /sana-/?
preverbal; allomorph of /ti=/ before vowel-initial verbs
preverbal; real marker used for all subjects except 2sg and 3sg

directional word?; meaning uncertain; cf. /si/ 'in, inside'

loan from Tok Pisin /taim/ 'time'; includes /ua/ 'where?'; also /lo ŋha nua/, /mla nua/

directional word?; meaning uncertain; cf. /ŋa/ 'over there'
same as 'to plant, to bury' (with verbal suffix /-rie/)?
